answers.answer: Yes eating something sugary will affect your results I drank apple juice before mine and failed my 1 hour test..you aren't even supposed to eat before your 3 hour test my doctor made me fast for 8 hours before I took my test they should have told you that you  needed to fast..I failed my 1 hour test but I passed my 3 hour test
I did fast or my 3 hr, but not for my one hour! I really hope the what I ate affected my one hr results!!

That's why I failed my one hour is because I drank apple juice like 10 minutes before I took mine..the 1 hour test isn't very accurate anyway..the 3 hour is..I failed my one hour blood draw from my three hour test but that was it..you have to fail two of the blood draws to fail the three hour test..all of my numbers were normal except for my one hour blood draw
Oh OK thanks! Well I have to wait for my results! They take forever, and the weird part of it, is that the lab is right in the office and they work their own lab!
I didn't get my results until my next appointment
I wasn't aloud to eat anything after midnight the night before... did they not say anything to you about food?
They told me to fast for the 3 hour test! They didn't tell me anything for the 1 hr test
How odd... don't worry about it though, A lot of people fail the 1 hour test.

question: At my 16 weeks app Dr told me that I had +2 glucose on urine, that same morning she sent me to do the 1 hr glucose test, I failed my one hour with 156 and cut off being 140 ( but that morning I had sugary breakfast) idk if it would affect my results! Yesterday I went to do my 3 hr test and I'm so desperate to get my results back! What I hate about the clinic its that they took a whole week to call me and tell me that I had failed my 1 hr, what am I supposed to do or eat while I get my 3 hr results back??
title: 17 weeks and gestational diabetes already???
